value.title: Ethics by Design: Salesforce's approach for positive AI and product development
value.excerpt: Paula Goldman, Chief Ethical and Humane Use Officer for Salesforce, talks with ZDNet about how companies can develop technology, specifically AI, with ethical use and privacy in mind.

value.title: Google Billionaire Eric Schmidt Warns Of 'National Emergency' If China Overtakes U.S. In AI Tech
value.excerpt: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt on Sunday urged lawmakers to ramp up funding for research and development in the artificial intelligence space in order to prevent China from becoming the biggest player in the global AI market–a development Schmidt warned would spark national security and privacy concerns that could ultimately constitute a national emergency.

value.title: Seminar on artificial intelligence in education
value.excerpt: A three-day online international seminar on ‘Artificial intelligence in education’ will begin on Monday. Being organised by the State Institute of Educational Technology, in association with the Depar

value.title: China Targets AI, Chips Among Seven Battlefronts in Tech Race With U.S.
value.excerpt: A five-year economic plan unveiled in Beijing promises more spending, loans to bolster development of advanced technologies.

value.title: UW’s Os Keyes takes on tech’s ethical challenges, from gender bias in AI to facial recognition
value.excerpt: A PhD candidate with the University of Washington's Department of Human Centered Design & Engineering, Os Keyes researches the ethical and political impact that new technologies have on the world.

value.title: 3 Top Artificial Intelligence Stocks to Buy in March
value.excerpt: The technology sector has been hit hard as of late, as the impending economic reopening has gotten more attention, and rising long-term bond rates have hit growth stocks particularly hard. As rates go up,

value.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is Changing the Present and Future of Digital Finance Market

value.title: This Site Spits Out AI-Generated Rejection Emails so You Can Copy and Paste Disappointment
value.excerpt: Crushing a starry-eyed startup’s hopes and dreams can be a pain, but now you can outsource that emotional labor to a heartless AI instead. Because rejection doesn’t have to hurt...err, not you at least,

value.title: UPDATE 1-Online learning platform Coursera files for U.S. IPO
value.excerpt: Online education provider Coursera Inc on Friday filed for a stock market listing with U.S. regulators, revealing a surge in revenue from a boost to business due to the disruption caused by the COVID-19 pandemic.

value.title: The Robots Are Coming for Phil in Accounting
value.excerpt: The robots are coming. Not to kill you with lasers, or beat you in chess, or even to ferry you around town in a driverless Uber. These robots are here to merge purchase orders into columns J and K of next quarter’s revenue forecast,

value.title: Open machine learning and AI data can increase ship energy efficiency
value.excerpt: The Swedish ship operator Ventrafiken and the research project “Data-driven energy efficiency for ships” (D2E2F) have established a collaboration to collect open data for research purposes. One of the double ended ferries (Uraniborg) have been equipped with a Blueflow Energy Management System to collect data on energy consumers and vessel data.

value.title: AI-Powered Chrome Extension Automatically Turns on YouTube Subtitles While You Eat Noisy Snacks
value.excerpt: A year into the pandemic most of us have honed our daily routines into a regular pattern of YouTube bingeing and snacking. But munching on crunchy snacks often makes it impossible to hear a video. The solution isn’t to turn off our computers and attempt to re-enter society,

value.title: Researchers developed an AI that scours existing drugs for new Alzheimer’s treatments
value.excerpt: Scientists used a machine-learning framework called DRIAD to identify a range of medications that could be repurposed to treat Alzheimer's disease.

value.title: Multimodal deep learning approach for event detection in sports using Amazon SageMaker
value.excerpt: Have you ever thought about how artificial intelligence could be used to detect events during live sports broadcasts? With machine learning (ML) techniques, we introduce a scalable multimodal solution for event detection on sports video data. Recent developments in deep learning show that event detection

value.title: Why AI is the Future of the Food Industry
value.excerpt: Knowledge and attitudes around global food production are undergoing a transformation. The sheer scale of the food industry and rapid shifts in culture make it difficult to assess this transformation succinctly.

value.title: Elon Musk: Tesla is doubling the size of its Full Self-Driving beta program
value.excerpt: Elon Musk says that Tesla is doubling the size of its Full Self-Driving Beta program with an upcoming new update. Another one following it could see the size of the test fleet increase by a factor of 10.

value.title: IDC: Ethical AI is a team sport that requires smart and strong referees
value.excerpt: New research finds that the lack of responsible artificial intelligence guidelines is one of the top three barriers to wider adoption.

value.title: Tom Cruise deepfake creator says public shouldn’t be worried about ‘one-click fakes’
value.excerpt: When a series of spookily convincing Tom Cruise deepfakes went viral on TikTok, some suggested it was a chilling sign of things to come — harbinger of an era where AI will let anyone make fake videos of anyone else.

value.title: NHAI introduces AI-based face recognition system for attendance monitoring
value.excerpt: In line with its commitment to adopt technology to enhance transparency and accountability, the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) has deployed artificial intelligence (AI)-based face recogni

value.title: Scientists made an AI that reads your mind so it can generate portraits you’ll find attractive
value.excerpt: A team of researchers recently developed a mind-reading AI that uses an individual’s personal preferences to generate portraits of attractive people who don’t exist. Computer-generated beauty truly is in the AI of the beholder.

value.title: Corsight AI addresses face biometrics ethics in Asia Pacific expansion
value.excerpt: Corsight AI has appointed William Tan and Amit Sarkar to lead the company’s efforts in the rapidly expanding Asia Pacific (APAC) market for face biometrics.

value.title: IBM launches AI platform to discover new materials
value.excerpt: IBM has launched a platform, MolGX, that leverages AI to discovery new materials with particular characteristics.

value.title: AI Weekly: These researchers are improving AI’s ability to understand different accents
value.excerpt: Researchers at MLCommons are developing a tool that would allow speech recognition developers to better support different accents.

value.title: 10 Women Changing the Landscape of Leadership
value.excerpt: In critical fields like agriculture, science, finance and technology, they have staked a claim with their pioneering work and are building a path for the next generation.

value.title: Apps, drone deliveries and AI: How technology stepped up its game to fight COVID-19
value.excerpt: A new report highlights the benefits, but also the shortcomings, of data-informed technologies and AI in the response to the COVID-19 crisis.
